contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=April 2013}} '''Barry Edward Dempster''' (born 17 January 1952) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[poet]] and [[novelist]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Milito|first=Philip|title=Barry Dempster|url=http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/articles/barry-dempster|work=The Canadian Encyclopedia|accessdate=15 April 2013}}</ref> Dempster was born and raised in [[Scarborough, Ontario|Scarborough]], [[Ontario]]. Two of his collections, ''Fables For Isolated Men'' (1982) and ''The Burning Alphabet'' (2005), were nominated for [[Governor General's Awards]]. ''The Burning Alphabet'' (2005) won the Canadian Authors Association Jack Chalmers Poetry Award in 2006. Dempster lives in [[Holland Landing, Ontario|Holland Landing]], Ontario. ==Bibliography== *''Fables For Isolated Men'' - 1982 (nominated for a [[1982 Governor General's Awards|Governor General's Award]]) *''Globe Doubts'' - 1983 *''Real Places and Imaginary Men'' - 1984 *''David and the Day Dreams'' - 1985 *''Writing Home'' - 1989 *''Positions to Pray In'' - 1989 *''The Unavoidable Man'' - 1990 *''The Ascension of Jesse Rapture'' - 1993 *''Fire and Brimstone'' - 1997 *''The Salvation of Desire'' - 2000 *''The Words Wanting Out: Selected and New Poems'' - 2003 *''The Burning Alphabet'' - 2005 (winner of the 2006 Canadian Authors Association Jack Chalmers Poetry Award and nominated for a [[2005 Governor General's Awards|Governor General's Award]]) *''Love Outlandish'' - 2009<ref>{{cite news|last=Vermeersch|first=Paul|title=An old subject, but a fresh approach|url=http://www.theglobeandmail.com/arts/books-and-media/love-outlandish-by-barry-dempster/article4277401/|accessdate=15 April 2013|newspaper=Toronto Globe and Mail|date=Jun. 19 2009}}</ref> *''Ivan's Birches'' - 2009 *''Blue Wherever'' - 2010 ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dempster, Barry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 17 January 1952 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dempster, Barry}} [[Category:Canadian poets]] [[Category:People from Scarborough, Ontario]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1952 births]]
